explains: n. 勒索，敲诈；胁迫，威胁；勒索金
v. 敲诈，勒索；要挟，胁迫

sentences.en: It looks like the pictures were being used for blackmail.
sentences.cn: 看来这些照片正被用于敲诈勒索。

sentences.en: She started off by accusing him of blackmail but he more or less ignored her.
sentences.cn: 她以指控他敲诈勒索开始，但他基本上没理会她。

sentences.en: You were the one that brought up the idea of blackmail. I'd never be a party to such a thing.
sentences.cn: 你是那个提出敲诈主意的人。我从来没想过参与这种事。
